text: Hey team. I'll be a little late coming into the office this morning since I'm currently troubleshooting my home wifi with a tech.

<@U0260V1BX> yep time tracking is a part of the scope but will be focused on after care plan, in terms of the project schedule. but for some additional context, what Annie is adding to the doc right now is what was in our original scope PLUS suggested additions from the HomePay team
ah ok

cool, thank you!

<@U026103R3> and team, I'm thinking through tomorrow's exercise, and wondering if we shouldn't just skip the items flagged as action cards. There aren't very many, and we're designing the pattern library for them anyway, so I don't see much benefit to prioritizing them, and they're a potentially confusing way to kick off our exercise.
I totally hear you on that Megan. I think we can just say that we're prioritizing features, and the features that make it into MVP will have associated action cards
<@U0HP6TFNX> In that case, would we start creating sticky notes for everything from Dashboard Onboarding and down?

We could. I'm still mentally walking through the exercise and thinking about moving a couple things, so if we could wait a little longer, I'd take advantage of the time to keep working here. Do you think we can wait another hour or so?
<@U0HP6TFNX> Yea just let us know when you feel it's ready. I can start by getting stickies ready for the headers, etc
I’ll keep reading through the document and better understanding it, but just let me know when I can jump in to help! :+1:
<@U1172PRDX> <@U0HP6TFNX> I’ve added in some comments/suggestions in the Care Share section.
thanks, taking a look now

<@U1172PRDX> let’s make sure we’re aligned on lexicon in this doc. I’m reserving “messaging” for the messaging feature that Care already has. In-session updates include Events, Photos, Videos, and Check-ins. The way we’d envisioned it in the last workstream, any communication between/among caregivers and families would happen within messaging. Our dashboard can initiate/send messages (i.e. if a caregiver can send a “running late” update from the dashboard, I imagine that that would appear in an ongoing message/convo with the family)
ok how do we talk about SMS messages (or eventually push notifications)?

I haven't gotten down to that section yet, so maybe this doesn't apply, but when possible, let's stay at the level of what events trigger communication, and leave ourselves the flexibility to figure out messaging types in the design process
yea i think i was using the general term "message caregiver/family" or something similar, which it looks like is confusing
agreed. But for any reference to SMS in this doc, let’s use the term SMS
i was confused about the difference between “message” and “communicate” and if either of those are within the scope of our workstreams or are an already-existing feature of the platform.
and i may have misunderstood the comment, but I thought “message” was being used to reference timeline updates.
:confused:
That’s a great question. I believe it’s referring to how we’ll tap into the current messaging system. <@U026103R3> can you confirm or correct?

Would it make sense to do this: everything that implies two way communication is "messaging," which we assume to fit into their existing messaging architecture, so it'll match their mental mode. We will figure out notification outside of messaging in our design process, so we don't need to do that in this exercise. And anything that is timeline specific we use terms add / edit /delete?
^ Makes sense to me

I started to add a section at the bottom called glossary where we can add terminology that we’re aligning on to reference. I added in `messaging` and will comb through to see if I can find any other language we may need to address. Feel free to add to this list as more come up!
good idea, thanks!
would be good to standardize on Care Share / CareShare so we don't write it different ways. I think we decided it should have a space.
Yeah, we’ve been adding a space between.
it's nit picky, but I'd also like to standardize what things are capitalized or not
totally not necessary for today but if it fits in your flow

I think space in Care Share makes sense as well - pretty sure our copy guidelines that we made in last round of project specified that if it's a product that care is offering that there is no space, and otherwise there is a space. Care Share is a use case IMO, not a standalone product.
I remember that part, and then I thought Care overruled the no-space convention, except for HomePay, unless I'm remembering wrong
Apologies if I used the wrong one!
Hmm, I don't remember that nuance Megan. I can try to look back at that doc
nah, it's fine, it doesn't matter here, but I notice it's inconsistent now so we'll want to figure it out before we start doing client facing deliverables
Separate from that naming convention stuff, I was noticing that terms like Caregiver are sometimes capitalized, sometimes not, so we should set up guidelines for us going forward.
Looks like we just went with spaces overall, except for homepay (looking at the writing guidelines doc now). so let's stick with Care Share.
I think it’s also notified as just CG
you're right
I can go through the doc and update Caregiver to follow form. How would we like to see this?
This doc isn't necessarily worth it but CG seems easiest for sticky notes and future docs.
Feels fine to me. <@U026103R3> since you’ll be reading these stickies, you cool with CG?

Quick question <@U0HP6TFNX>–we discussed clarifying “modules” or “buckets”. I really like the way we referenced those before as “feature sets”, so to make sure I understand and we’re all on the same page, an example of a feature set would be Onboarding or Pre-session or In-Session and the features fall within those. Correct? Even though Shelia/Care may reference those differently, I think we as a team can work to be unified in this way.
I consider Onboarding et al to be phases. Feature sets would replace the squishy "module" terminology for things like Care Plan, Get Care. A feature set would include individual features.
<@U026103R3> <@U5ZLKG7FW> is there a trello board that we're tracking this stuff with?
<@U0HP6TFNX> ah yeah. that’s right. thanks for clarifying. I’ll add those to glossary so we’re all on the same page.

<@U1172PRDX> yeah
Dashboard / Plan: <https://trello.com/b/pVAciUXQ/care-dashboard-care-plam>
Care Share: <https://trello.com/b/hOZCm4L0/care-share>

head's up it's pretty empty atm but i'm working on adding out of scope items and can help with continuing to flesh it out

ok no worries
just wanted to make sure i wasn't missing it!

no, I should have made that grey
ok cool thanks
<@U0HP6TFNX> thinking back to our thought yesterday about putting a sticker on anything homepay related - is there any indicator in the doc of this so i can do that as i go along?

Hey <!channel>, we’re doing great work within this doc to prep and get ready for our kickoff. Love it! With that in mind, I’m thinking ahead with the work that we have scheduled and I think it may be important for us to start diving into some the details of what we have defined. Our project plan outlines onboarding as the first feature we’ll be addressing. <@U0XJFPSRL> are you able to start digging in here to keep the team moving along? <@U0HP6TFNX> any suggestions or thoughts on how Elise could approach this more granularly to start us off? And <@U0260V1BX>, if/when you’re feeling good with this doc, could you jump in with Elise if possible?

Good idea - I just shared a work in progress doc with elise with some structure for our UX deliverables: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/1U3cikOjK4MXSlueIn3f60K0HQNIViRGkvAh91xkvZXU/edit?usp=sharing>
With this in mind, I think it would be good to start by outlining our happy path scenario and alternate scenarios from the family perspective first, since that's how Care thinks.
We lean on our agenda to inform these scenarios
Outline that instead of onboarding?
sorry - outline the onboarding scenario
Okay
We can chat if that raises additional questions. there are many good ways to get the ball rolling, this is just one idea.
Cool, that sounds good. Just to clarify, are you both talking about the “Dashboard Onboarding” section in the Feature Inventory?
Yup!
And is the goal to have this more flushed out as-is (irregardless of feature priority)?
Yeah, I think so. We’ll have more definition around that after Friday and we can shift when we know more, but starting to lay the ground work will be good for us to get started.
Sounds good
Thanks, Elise! Let us know if you have any questions.
Will do!
<@U1172PRDX> i wouldn’t worry too much about the Care Share section being light. It’s a smaller feature relatively speaking, but i think there will be lots of complexity within each sub-feature.
